reference.title: derby.drda.startNetworkServer property
reference.shortdesc: Indicates whether the Network Server will start automatically when you start .

section.p: Use the derby.drda.startNetworkServer property to simplify embedding the Network Server in your Java application. When you set this property to true, the Network Server will automatically start when you start (in this context, will start when the embedded driver is loaded). Only one Network Server can be started in a JVM.

p.note: If you start the Network Server with this property set to true, the Network Server will stop when your application ends or when you stop it by other means (for example, by using the Java API or the command line interface, or by shutting down the system), whichever comes first.

section.title: Static or dynamic
section.p: Static. You must shut down the Network Server and restart for this change to take effect.
